hpnicfMDC.name: hpnicfMDC

revisions.description: The initial revision of this MIB module.

hpnicfMDC.description: This MIB contains objects to manage MDC (Multitenant Device Context) operations. Such as: 1. Configure MDCs for a device and display MDCs and their status. 2. Assign CPU, storage space, and memory space resources to the MDC, and display their status. 3. Authorize the MDC to use the interface cards, and assign physical interfaces to an MDC. Default MDC: A device supporting MDCs is an MDC itself, and it is called the default MDC. From the default MDC, administrators can manage the entire physical device, create and delete non-default MDCs, and assign interfaces, CPU resources, storage space, and memory space to non-default MDCs. Non-default MDC: No MDCs can be created on a non-default MDC. Administrators of non-default MDCs can only manage and maintain their respective MDCs. A non-default MDC can use only the resources assigned to it.

HpnicfMdcActionValue.name: HpnicfMdcActionValue
HpnicfMdcActionValue.description: start: start the MDC stop: stop the MDC

HpnicfMdcRunStatus.name: HpnicfMdcRunStatus
HpnicfMdcRunStatus.description: Status of the MDC: inactive: The MDC is stopped or not started yet. starting: The device is executing the mdc start command to start the MDC. active: The MDC is operating properly. stopping: The device is executing the undo mdc start command to stop the MDC. updating: The device is executing the location command to authorize the MDC to use an interface card.

hpnicfMDCMaxMDCNum.name: hpnicfMDCMaxMDCNum
hpnicfMDCMaxMDCNum.description: The maximum number of MDCs which the system supported to create.

hpnicfMDCCurrentMDCNum.name: hpnicfMDCCurrentMDCNum
hpnicfMDCCurrentMDCNum.description: The current number of MDCs which the system has created.

hpnicfMDCControlTable.name: hpnicfMDCControlTable
hpnicfMDCControlTable.description: This table is used to configure MDCs for a device and show MDC's status.

hpnicfMDCControlEntry.name: hpnicfMDCControlEntry
hpnicfMDCControlEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCControlTable, every entry is corresponding with an MDC.

hpnicfMDCIndex.name: hpnicfMDCIndex
hpnicfMDCIndex.description: MDC ID is used as MDCIndex, the value range of MDC ID depends on the device model. MDCIndex cannot be modified after creation.

hpnicfMDCName.name: hpnicfMDCName
hpnicfMDCName.description: Specifies the MDC name, a case-sensitive string of 1 to 15 characters. The MDC name cannot be modified after creation.

hpnicfMDCAction.name: hpnicfMDCAction
hpnicfMDCAction.description: State of MDC action: start/stop. After an MDC is started, administrators of the MDC can log in to the MDC for MDC configuration and maintenance. Stopping an MDC interrupts all services on the MDC and logs out all users of the MDC. Non-default MDC cannot operate.

hpnicfMDCRowStatus.name: hpnicfMDCRowStatus
hpnicfMDCRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. Only support active, createAndGo and destroy.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceTable.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceTable
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceTable.description: This table is for disk resource management: Specify a disk space percentage for an MDC and display the disk space usage. Default: All MDCs share the disk space in the system, and an MDC can use all free disk space in the system. Non-default MDC can only query the disk space usage.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceEntry.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceEntry
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCDISKResourceTable, every entry is corresponding to disk resource of an MDC. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstance.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstance
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstance.description: Instance index of disk resource. Different instances for disk: Flash, CF cards.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstanceName.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstanceName
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceInstanceName.description: Instance name of disk resource. Such as: Flash, CF cards.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMinLimit.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMinLimit
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMinLimit.description: Limit minimum (reserve resources, must be all 0).

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMaxLimit.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMaxLimit
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceMaxLimit.description: Maximum of available resources of disk. Make sure the disk space amount assigned to an MDC is greater than the disk space amount the MDC is using. Non-default MDC cannot set

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceReserve.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceReserve
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceReserve.description: The reserve limit resources of disk.

hpnicfMDCDISKResourceQuota.name: hpnicfMDCDISKResourceQuota
hpnicfMDCDISKResourceQuota.description: The total limit resources of disk according to hpnicfMDCDiskResourceMaxLimit.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceTable.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceTable
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceTable.description: This table is for memory resource management: Specify a memory space percentage for an MDC and display the memory space usage. Default: All MDCs share the memory space in the system, and an MDC can use all free memory. Non-default MDC can only query resource message of memory.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceEntry.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceEntry
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceTable, every entry is corresponding with memory resource of an MDC. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMinLimit.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMinLimit
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMinLimit.description: Limit minimum(reserve resources, must be all 0). Non-default MDC cannot set.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMaxLimit.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMaxLimit
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceMaxLimit.description: Maximum of available resources of memory, it specifies the ratio of the memory space that an MDC can use. Make sure this amount is sufficient for the MDC to operate properly. Non-default MDC cannot set.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceReserve.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceReserve
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceReserve.description: The reserve limit resources of memory.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceQuota.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceQuota
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceQuota.description: The total limit resources of memory.

hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceAvailable.name: hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceAvailable
hpnicfMDCMemoryResourceAvailable.description: Current available value of memory resources.

hpnicfMDCCPUResourceTable.name: hpnicfMDCCPUResourceTable
hpnicfMDCCPUResourceTable.description: This table is for CPU resource management: Specify a CPU weight for an MDC and display the CPU usage. The amount of CPU resources an MDC can use depends on the CPU weight settings for all MDCs that share the same CPU. Non-default MDC can only query CPU resources.

hpnicfMDCCPUResourceEntry.name: hpnicfMDCCPUResourceEntry
hpnicfMDCCPUResourceEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCCPUResourceTable, every entry is corresponding with CPU resources of an MDC. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCCPUResourceLimit.name: hpnicfMDCCPUResourceLimit
hpnicfMDCCPUResourceLimit.description: CPU weight-maximum of available resources of CPU, this number specifies a CPU weight for an MDC. Non-default MDC cannot set.

hpnicfMDCLocationTable.name: hpnicfMDCLocationTable
hpnicfMDCLocationTable.description: This table is for location management: Authorize an MDC to use an interface card and query state of location. To assign physical interfaces to an MDC, administrators must authorize the MDC to use the interface cards to which the physical interfaces belong. Default: All interface cards of the device belong to the default MDC, and a non-default MDC cannot use any interface card. Non-default MDC can only query location state.

hpnicfMDCLocationEntry.name: hpnicfMDCLocationEntry
hpnicfMDCLocationEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCLocationTable, every entry is the status whether an MDC has been Authorized to use the interface cards. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCLocationStatus.name: hpnicfMDCLocationStatus
hpnicfMDCLocationStatus.description: To authorize the MDC to use the interface cards, set the value of this object to 'true (1)'. To cancel the authorization, set this value to 'false (2)'. Note that the return noError means the command is being executed. For the execution result, check hpnicfMDCLocationStatus.

hpnicfMDCGroupIfTable.name: hpnicfMDCGroupIfTable
hpnicfMDCGroupIfTable.description: This table indication of relation between interfaces and groups, which helps to realize the allocation, together with hpnicfMDCAllocateTable. Non-default MDC cannot operate.

hpnicfMDCGroupIfEntry.name: hpnicfMDCGroupIfEntry
hpnicfMDCGroupIfEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCGroupIfTable, every entry is the relationship between interfaces and groups. Due to hardware restrictions, the interfaces on some interface cards are grouped. The interfaces in a group must be assigned to the same MDC at the same time or removed from an MDC at the same time. Interface grouping depends on the device model. This table is used for hpnicfMDCAllocateTable to show interfae group lists. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical ports (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'port(10)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCGroupIdentity.name: hpnicfMDCGroupIdentity
hpnicfMDCGroupIdentity.description: The interface group ID. There are two parts for this id depicted as follows: 31 7 0 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ + entity index + group index + + ( bit 8..31 ) ( bit 0..7 ) + +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ From bit0 to bit7 (one byte), it is interfaces group index. From bit8 to bit31 (three bytes), it is the physical index the same as the entPhysicalIndex specified in ENTITY-MIB. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCAllocateTable.name: hpnicfMDCAllocateTable
hpnicfMDCAllocateTable.description: This table is used to assigning a physical interface to an MDC. It is allowed that allocate interfaces to a non-default MDC from the default MDC, and allocate interfaces back to the default MDC from a non-default MDC. All physical interfaces on the device belong to the default MDC, and a non-default MDC has no physical interfaces to use. Multiple physical interfaces can be assigned to a non-default MDC. A physical interface must meet the following conditions to be assigned to a non-default MDC: 1. Belongs to the default MDC. 2. Not the console or AUX port. 3. Not the management Ethernet interface. 4. Not in an interface group with an interface assigned to another MDC. 5. The default MDC uses only the physical interfaces that are not assigned to a non-default MDC. Non-default MDC cannot set this table.

hpnicfMDCAllocateEntry.name: hpnicfMDCAllocateEntry
hpnicfMDCAllocateEntry.description: An entry of the hpnicfMDCAllocateTable, every entry is the status whether physical interfaces have been assigned to an MDC.

hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupIndex.name: hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupIndex
hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupIndex.description: The interface group ID, the same as hpnicfMDCGroupIdentity. There are two parts for this id. depicted as follows: 31 7 0 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ + entity index + group index + + ( bit 8..31 ) ( bit 0..7 ) + +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ From bit0 to bit7 (one byte), it is interfaces group index. From bit8 to bit31 (three bytes), it is the physical index the same as the entPhysicalIndex specified in ENTITY-MIB. Note that only entPhysicalIndex values that represent physical boards (i.e., associated entPhysicalClass value is 'module(9)') are permitted to exist in this table.

hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupDescription.name: hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupDescription
hpnicfMDCAllocateGroupDescription.description: Interfaces list Such as: GigabitEthernet4/5/0/1 to GigabitEthernet4/5/0/24, GigabitEthernet4/5/0/48

hpnicfMDCAllocateMDCId.name: hpnicfMDCAllocateMDCId
hpnicfMDCAllocateMDCId.description: MDC ID is used as hpnicfMDCAllocateMDCId. Default MDC: It is allowed that allocate interfaces to non-default MDC from the default MDC, and allocate interfaces back to the default MDC from a non-default MDC. Non-default MDC cannot set allocation, can only query grouping of own MDC.

hpnicfMDCStateChangeToActive.name: hpnicfMDCStateChangeToActive
hpnicfMDCStateChangeToActive.description: The hpnicfMDCStateChangeToActive trap indicates that the MDC status has changed to active.

hpnicfMDCStateChangeToInactive.name: hpnicfMDCStateChangeToInactive
hpnicfMDCStateChangeToInactive.description: The hpnicfMDCStateChangeToInactive trap indicates that the MDC status has changed to inactive.
